required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: To Assess the Anti-adhesive Effect and Safety of Protescal
clinical_study.official_title: To Assess the Anti-adhesive Effect and Safety of Protescal Following Laparoscopic Surgery

oversight_info.authority: South Korea: Korea Food and Drug Administration (KFDA)

brief_summary.textblock: This multicenter, randomized, single-blind study assessed the safety and efficacy of Protescal for the reduction of post-operative adhesion formation following myomectomy.

detailed_description.textblock: The age of the patients participating in the study overed 20 years and included nonpregnant women requiring laparoscopic myomectomy and expected to undergo a second-look laparoscopy as part of their treatment plan 5 weeks after the initial surgery.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Prevention

primary_outcome.measure: presence/absence of postoperative adhesions at second-look procedure
primary_outcome.time_frame: at second look laparoscopy after 5 weeks later initial laparoscopic myomectomy

arm_group.description: Protescal is applied to this arm.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- a woman who is over 20 years old
- a woman who needs a laparoscopic myomectomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- a pregnant woman and a nursing mother

clinical_study.keyword: anti-adhesive effect and safety, laparoscopic myomectomy
